questions.question: What is the first step in the Engineering Design process?

choices.answer: Define the problem
Research about what has already been done about the problem
Ask a question
Build a prototype

questions.question: In which step of the process do you come up with as many good ideas as you an think of?

choices.answer: Specify requirements
Brainstorm solutions
Test the design
Build a prototype

questions.question: Which step do you take after you do background research?

choices.answer: Brainstorm solutions
Redesign
Build a prototype
Specify requirements (criteria and constraints)

questions.question: How do you select the best solution?

choices.answer: Find out which one is everyone's favorite
Choose the one that costs the least to make
Look at which ones meet most of the requirements
Look at which one would be the most fun to build.

questions.question: What is an iteration in the Engineering Design process

choices.answer: Different versions of the prototype as you redesign it
It is the first prototype
It is how you explain your solution to others
It is a play on words when you give your project a title

questions.question: Why do engineers document their final solutions in reports and/or display boards?

choices.answer: So that the owners will choose their design
So that they an get the best grade
To show off to the other engineers
So that the solution can be accurately manufactured and supported

questions.question: Why do engineers do background research on a project?

choices.answer: To learn from the experiences of others
To make sure they like their solution
To find out how much to charge for their solution
To specify the requirements

questions.question: What happens in the "develop the solution" step?

choices.answer: Drawing out the design of the solution
Building a model
Refinement and improvement of a solution idea.
Reporting the results of testing

questions.question: Which step may lead to re-designing?

choices.answer: Defining the problem
Background research
Brainstorming solutions
Testing
A robot
A written report about the solution
An operating version of the solution.
A detailed diagram of the solution
